member.summary: Month and period data used for parsing dates from GEDCOM files.

member.summary: All month names that might come up in GEDCOM date formats, abbreviated, non English as well.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Data.StaticDateData.GedcomDateParseDelimiters
member.summary: Delimiters that are valid for parsing the date parts of a GEDCOM date record.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Data.StaticDateData.PeriodMappings
member.summary:
A list of mappings of text prefixes and suffixes to their GEDCOM types. Not all of these are valid as many tags come from programmes that do not obey the standards. Longer strings that match the start of shorter strings should be listed first (ABT. before ABT).
Of particular note; C or CIRCA from BROSKEEP files, C may be due to the date being set from a baptism / christening, but if that is the case estimate is still reasonable to go with.
BROSKEEP seems to be stupid and doesn't make proper use of CAL e.g 'BU.9-6-1825' for a death date means it is really the burial date that has just been copied to the death date. Same with birth / baptism.

member.summary: Annulment
member.remarks: Declaring a marriage void from the beginning (never existed).

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Enums.GedcomEventType.CENS_FAM
member.summary: Census
member.remarks: The event of the periodic count of the population for a designated locality, such as a national or state Census.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Enums.GedcomEventType.DIV
member.summary: Divorce
member.remarks: An event of dissolving a marriage through civil action.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Enums.GedcomEventType.DIVF
member.summary: Divorce Filed
member.remarks: An event of filing for a divorce by a spouse.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Enums.GedcomEventType.ENGA
member.summary: Engagement
member.remarks: An event of recording or announcing an agreement between two people to become married.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Enums.GedcomEventType.MARB
member.summary: Marriage Bann
member.remarks: An event of an official public notice given that two people intend to marry.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Enums.GedcomEventType.MARC
member.summary: Marriage Contract
member.remarks: An event of recording a formal agreement of marriage, including the prenuptial agreement in which marriage partners reach agreement about the property rights of one or both, securing property to their children.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Enums.GedcomEventType.MARR
member.summary: Marriage
member.remarks: A legal, common-law, or customary event of creating a family unit of a man and a woman as husband and wife.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Enums.GedcomEventType.MARL
member.summary: Marriage License
member.remarks: An event of obtaining a legal license to marry.

member.name: F:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Enums.GedcomEventType.MARS
member.summary: Marriage Settlement
member.remarks: An event of creating an agreement between two people contemplating marriage, at which time they agree to release or modify property rights that would otherwise arise from the marriage.

member.name: M:GeneGenie.Gedcom.GedcomRecord.IsEquivalentTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Must be overridden in derived classes to compare the user entered data for that instance. Called from the method before it checks common data elements (notes, sources etc.). We use the word equivalent so that we avoid using the word equals. This is because we are checking user entered data only and as far as the end user cares, two records can be equivalent (matching) but they might be two different individuals / families etc.
member.param: The object to compare this instance against.
member.returns: True if instance matches user data, otherwise False.

member.name: M:GeneGenie.Gedcom.GedcomRecord.Equals(GeneGenie.Gedcom.GedcomRecord)
member.summary: Compares the inheriting instance user entered data against the passed GedcomRecord. If that matches, will then compare the common elements of the passed GedcomRecord against this instance (Source etc. which are common to all inheritors).
member.returns: True if the core base properties match, otherwise False.

member.name: T:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser
member.summary: GedcomParser is responsible for parsing GEDCOM files. This class implements GEDCOM 5.5 grammar rules. This is probably not the class you want to use unless writing a validator application. GedcomRecordReader makes use of this class for building up a GedcomDatabase.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.TagCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of xrefs used in the gedcom file. This is used as a cache to lower memory consumption. If not set one will be created when parsing.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.XrefCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of xrefs used in the gedcom file. This is used as a cache to lower memory consumption. Setting this to an XRefIndexedKeyCollection will allow on the fly replacement of xrefs. If not set one will be created when parsing.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.Charset
member.summary: Gets or sets the character set used to encode the GEDCOM file.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.IgnoreInvalidDelim
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether invalid delimiters cause errors. If set to true invalid GEDCOM files that use multiple spaces to separate level / xrefid / tags will be processed without generating an error. royal.ged from Gedcom.pm (http://www.pjcj.net) needs this as the tags are indented presumably for readability.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.IgnoreMissingTerms
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether missing terminators cause an error. If set to true GEDCOM lines that do not contain a terminator on tags / line values will not cause the parser to generate an error.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.ApplyConcContOnNewLineHack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to leave newlines in. Some broken apps (Reunion for instance) omit CONT (and maybe CONC) values, leading to broken GEDCOM. When set to true the parser will deal with this by converting the broken line to another CONC.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.AllowTabs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow tabs as OtherChar.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.AllowLineTabs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow line tabs as OtherChar.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.AllowInformationSeparatorOne
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow Information Separator One (0x1f) as OtherChar.

member.name: P:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.AllowHyphenOrUnderscoreInTag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow - or _ in tag names.

member.summary: Obtain a human readable error message for the given error state.
member.returns: A friendlier string for the error.

member.name: M:GeneGenie.Gedcom.Parser.GedcomParser.GedcomParse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the given data, which should be 1 or more lines, multiple calls can be made with multiple lines. Events are triggered upon reading a line, or on an error. If TagCollection and XrefTagCollection haven't been set prior to calling default IndexedKeyCollection objects will be used. To support replacing XRefs you need to set XrefTagCollection to an instance of XRefIndexedKeyCollection before calling.
member.param: Data to parse, expected to be unicode.
member.returns: The last error encountered.

member.summary: Resets the parser states, use this if the same GedcomParser is ready to parse a different gedcom file, or if recovering from an error the parser has hit.
